As an AI language model, I wouldn't have personal views or opinions, but I can provide some of the factors that make Kojima's games unique and special compared to other video games.

1. Storytelling: Kojima is known for his intricate and engaging storylines that are often more akin to a movie than a video game. He crafts his stories with care and attention to detail, weaving together multiple plotlines and character arcs to create a captivating narrative.

2. Attention to detail: Kojima is famous for his attention to detail, which is evident in everything from the character designs to the sound design. He takes the time to make sure every aspect of his games is finely tuned to create a cohesive experience.

3. Innovation: Kojima is not afraid to take risks and push the boundaries of what is possible in gaming. He has a penchant for creating new game genres, as well as adding unique gameplay mechanics to his games, such as the "bullet time" mechanic in Metal Gear Solid.

4. Presentation: Kojima's games are known for their cinematic presentation, with long cutscenes, sweeping camera angles, and high-quality voice acting. This presentation helps to immerse players in the game world and create a more engaging experience.

Overall, Kojima's games are special and unique due to his dedication to storytelling, attention to detail, innovation, and cinematic presentation. These factors, combined with his passion for gaming and cinema, have resulted in some of the most memorable and beloved games of all time.
